claims.claim: Redlining still exists, affecting where people can live.
claims.quote: Housing is a, they might not have it officially anymore, but redlining still exists.

claims.claim: Formerly incarcerated individuals face significant challenges in securing housing.
claims.quote: And within three hours we were all now no longer approved. [...] purely because I was in prison.

claims.claim: High credit scores and financial readiness do not negate the impact of a criminal record on housing applications.
claims.quote: I have nearly an 800 credit score. And so there's nothing else that goes into this except for that.

claims.claim: Formerly incarcerated individuals often are not the primary lessee due to discrimination.
claims.quote: I'm not on my lease right now. My wife is on the lease.

claims.claim: Universities contribute to housing shortages and prices, exacerbating challenges for formerly incarcerated individuals.
claims.quote: The problem is you have Eastern Michigan and you have University of Michigan, so they've got a transient population that can always fill their housing.

claims.claim: Legislation exists to prevent discrimination against formerly incarcerated individuals in housing applications, but enforcement is lax.
claims.quote: If part of Ann Arbor actually has something on the books that says they can't use your incarceration against you on the front end. On the back end, they still can.

claims.claim: Homeownership is often viewed as the only reliable pathway to stable housing for formerly incarcerated individuals.
claims.quote: The only real way out of this in a lot of ways is home ownership.
